title: N'Golo Kante reveals he almost joined Marseille before leading Leicester to the Premier League title
text:
N'Golo Kante reveals he almost joined Marseille before leading Leicester to the Premier League title The French midfielder joined the Foxes for £5.6m from Caen instead of remaining in his homeland Share So near yet so far for Marseille (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images) Share Get   
N’Golo Kante has revealed he could have joined Marseille before he signed for Leicester . 
The Premier League’s and Leicester’s history could have been very different had Kante’s career path continued as he expected when the time came to leave Caen in the summer of 2015. 
Instead of Marseille, though, Kante joined the Foxes as Claudio Ranieri’s first signing for a bargain £5.6m. 
And it proved to be money very well spent as midfielder Kante inspired Leicester to their historic and shock title win last season. Kante could be wearing a Marseille shirt rather than Chelsea this season (Photo: Getty) Kante could be on the way to back-to-back Premier League titles (Photo: Getty) 
Kante said: “Among the clubs that most wanted to recruit me were Marseille and Leicester. I thought I had to go through a stage in France. 
“I remember the generation of [Mamadou] Niang, [Franck] Ribery and [Samir] Nasri and it was a team that I liked, especially in the Champions League.” 
As well as a Premier League winners’ medal, Kante also earned a £30m move to Chelsea off the back of his exploits at Leicester. 
He is on course for a second successive title this season with Antonio Conte’s side.
